title: Authors and Citation
text: Ali Y, Butler S, Snyder K (2024). SENDsanitizer: Generate Fake SEND Data. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/phuse-org/SENDsanitizer.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SENDsanitizer: Generate Fake SEND Data},   author = {Yousuf Ali and Susan Butler and Kevin Snyder},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/phuse-org/SENDsanitizer}, }

title: Generate Fake SEND Data
text: Based example SEND Repeat-Dose Toxicity Studies, generates new studies follow similar dose responsive trends modelling purposes. currently generates ts, dm, tx, bw, lb, om, mi domains.

title: Generate Fake SEND Data
text: random number generated STUDYID utilized across domains data creation. Dates replaced ‘XXXX-XX-XX’ relevant domains. TS, DM, TX TS domain, identifiable information like study facility details, location, study title, vehicle names replaced pre-defined values (‘FAKE FACILITY’ facility, ‘XXXX-XX-XX’ dates). Details study director, animal purchasing location, test facility country eliminated. DM domain, STUDYID replaced randomly generated STUDYID, USUBJID changed unique number concatenating randomly generated STUDYID SUBJID. ARM replaced Control, LD, MD, HD appropriate. ARMCD replaced dose order. dose order defines following way Control 1 LD 2 MD 3 HD 4 TX domain, SET variable updated Control, LD, MD, HD values. TXPARMCD Variable: group label (GRPLBL) information replaced concatenating dose order dose value (.e. Group 1, Control 1 order Control dose). TRTDOS replaced dose (Control, LD, MD, HD). ARMCD SPGRPCD replaced dose order (1,2,3,4). Value parameter SPLRNAM, SSPONSOR, SPREFID SPLRLOC contain identifiable information TXPARMCD removed BW LB OM Domain Bayesian Regression model build domain BW, LB OM using MCMCregress function MCMCpack R package MCMCpack: Markov Chain Monte Carlo R. Numerical Data generated using model. STUDYID, USUBJID, dates replaced previously described within LB, BW OM domain. LB group Control, male rats whrere LBCAT CLINICAL CHEMISTRY choosen. Mean LBTEST (PHOS, CA, CHOL, BIL, ALP etc) calculated group. let’s say following table Mean LBTESTCD. build model ALT, algorithmically choose nearest two value, case choose PROT ALB MCMCpack::MCMCregress("ALT ~ PROT + ALB", b0=0,B0=0.1, data= line) line dataframe LBSTRESN LBTESTCD Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) output: randomly choosen model calculate ALT value specific animal. ALT = INTERCEPT + COF_PROT * PROT + COF_ALB * ALB noise added noise <- stats::rnorm(1,mean=0,sd=(standard_deviation_of_that_group_for_ALT) final_value = ALT + noise case value returned negative, algorithmically different model choosen. Code try max 10 times. fails, absolute value taken final value. MI domain percentage incidence serverity calculated.

title: Generate Fake SEND Data
text: Development version can installed GitHub.
code: # install devtools if already not installed  install.packages("devtools")  #install toxSummary package devtools::install_github('phuse-org/SENDsanitizer')

title: Generate Fake SEND Data
text: Clone GitHub repo set repo working directory. Notes Example SEND Studies: recommended use multiple example studies better results. SEND format example studies must similar arms/dosing regimens (option include exclude recovery animals), SEND Version, SSTYP species. script checks values similar provide errors based conditions met.

title: function to generate fake data — sanitize
code: sanitize(   path,   number = 1,   recovery = FALSE,   where_to_save = NULL,   write_xpt = FALSE,   test_original = FALSE )

title: function to generate fake data — sanitize
text: path Mandatory path real data/xpt files located, directory contains xpt files, one multiple directory can given. number mandatory, default 1 many studies generate. Currently work 1 recovery optional recovery where_to_save mandatory save generated xpt files. directory. write_xpt mandatory, boolean write file . TRUE, xpt file created. test_original mandatory, boolean generate dataset original value generated value bw, lb, mi, om domain. default FALSE. write file . TRUE, xpt file created.
